snippet: The C.D.C. said recent blood donations suggest that a substantial portion of the island’s population will become infected by the virus.
abstract: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention reveals testing of roughly 9 weeks of blood donations in Puerto Rico shows active Zika infection rate to be as high as 1.1 percent; figure is unexpectedly high and indicates island faces substantial rate of infection by end of year.

byline.contributor: Like the Science Times page on Facebook. | Sign up for the Science Times newsletter.

lead_paragraph: The C.D.C. said recent blood donations suggest that a substantial portion of the island’s population will become infected by the virus.

headline.main: Number of Zika-Positive Puerto Ricans Surprises Health Officials
headline.print_headline: U.S. Officials Are Surprised by Zika Rate in Puerto Rico

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
